00008 //This file contains a bunch of handy snippets for debugging, mostly
00009 //runtime checks like memory usage and stopwatches.

00011 #define DEBUG_PRINT std::cout << "@ " << __FILE__ << ":" << __LINE__ << std::endl;

00013 namespace DEBUG {
00014   //--------------------------------------------------------------------
00015   struct time_log {
00016     time_log(int c, int u) : cpu(c), user(u) {
00017       snprintf(str, 64, "CPU/User(ms) = %4d / %4d",cpu, user);
00018     };
00019     
00020     static char str[64];
00021     int cpu; 
00022     int user;
00023   };
00024 
00025   char time_log::str[] = {0};
00026   
00027   template<int I> 
00028     const time_log check_clock(){
00029     static TStopwatch watch;
00030     watch.Stop();
00031     time_log log(1000 * watch.CpuTime(), 1000 * watch.RealTime());
00032     watch.Start();
00033     return log;
00034   }
00035 
00036   time_log check_clock() {
00037     return check_clock<0xBADBEEF>();
00038   }
00039 
00040   //--------------------------------------------------------------------
00041   struct mem_log {
00042     mem_log(int r, int v) : res(r), virt(v) 
00043     {
00044      snprintf(str, 64, "Res/Virt(MiB) = %4d / %4d",res, virt);
00045     };
00046 
00047     static char str[64];
00048     int res;
00049     int virt;
00050   };
00051 
00052   char mem_log::str[] = {0};
00053 
00054   const mem_log check_mem(){
00055     static ProcInfo_t proc;
00056     gSystem->GetProcInfo(&proc);
00057     return mem_log(proc.fMemResident /1024., proc.fMemVirtual /1024.);
00058   }
00059 };
